sources.title: Opportunity Assessment and Solution Space - End of service

prd_context.why_built: Enable HR Admin and Finance Managers to calculate final settlement for end of service efficiently within Bayzat, replacing time-consuming Excel-based processes. Automate gratuity calculations with accurate formulas and integrate leave/attendance data automatically.; Give HR administrators control over employee profile data integrity through photo upload capability, permission-based editing restrictions, and customizable employee directory fields to address issues with larger organizations where employees modify sensitive data.; Enhance employee document management to meet compliance, business, and legal requirements. Enable creation and configuration of custom document types with expiry tracking and automated reminders. Allow HR to manage the complete document lifecycle from pre-hire through exit.; Improve employee list management for companies with large workforces. Enable admins to view up to 500 employees at once, use global search accessible via CMD/CTRL+K from anywhere, see recently viewed employees and recent searches for quick access.; Enable finance managers to calculate and settle employee final settlements when leaving the company, including gratuity calculation, leave encashment, outstanding loans, and prorated salary. Automate confusing EOS calculations based on service duration, departure reason, and contract type.; Allow users to customize the data columns in pre/post sync reports for accounting integrations (Netsuite, MS Dynamics). This enables companies to upload employee-level data to their ERP systems to track employee costs using a customizable CSV/Excel file.

Pull pay data (salary, expenses, loans) from payroll system
Calculate leave encashment and unpaid leave deductions automatically
Apply gratuity formula (MOL or custom) based on free zone
Support multiple currencies for non-UAE employees
Exclude work handover, asset clearance, visa cancellation, insurance cancellation from scope
Allow admins to upload employee profile photos when employees don't add them
Configure permissions to restrict employee editing of documents, personal/work info, and dependent data
Implement approval workflow for document and payment details changes
Customize employee directory fields to show relevant information like country of residence and manager
Support both Mobile and Web platforms with Arabic translation
Create and configure custom document types with expiry tracking
Implement automated email reminders (1-12 months before expiry)
Support both default and custom document types with mandatory status configuration
Provide timely expiry notifications so managers can proactively initiate document renewals
Special handling for 'Others' document type with locked expiry toggle
Support Emirates ID format variations (old and new formats)
Support viewing up to 500 employees per page (configurable: 10/25/50/100/250/500)
Implement global search accessible via CMD/CTRL+K from anywhere in product
Show recently viewed employees (up to 5) and recent searches (up to 5)
Display additional employee data points (role, department) directly in list
Rename 'View team' section to 'Employees'
Disable future dates in DOB date picker
Show UAE-specific fields only when Legal Country of Residence is UAE
Auto-calculate gratuity based on MOL formula with override capability
Fetch time-off balance for leave encashment calculation
Calculate prorated salary based on departure date
Include variable pay and work expenses in calculations
Support custom gratuity calculations with admin remarks
Handle rehire scenarios before EOS submission
Lock edits post-payment submission
Implement wizard-based report template configuration
Allow mapping of employee profile fields, custom employee data, and custom company data
Make default pre/post sync report columns mandatory and non-deletable
Allow reordering of columns including default columns
Exclude payroll fields from mapping to prevent sensitive data exposure
Support empty column option for ERP compatibility
Generate reports as CSV or Excel format

Job titles and reporting hierarchy from employee records support performance evaluation and management
Insurance policy details and employee information from records integrated with benefits administration
Leave balances and time-off data used for leave encashment calculations in end of service settlements
Pending and approved work expenses must be resolved before end of service submission
Outstanding loan balances brought forward and deducted from end of service settlements
Automated email reminders for document expiry, invitation resends, and approval requests
End of service process complements offboarding workflow for departing employees
Employee-level data exported to Netsuite and MS Dynamics via customizable pre/post sync reports for cost tracking
Employee documents and records accessible on mobile devices in manager mode with limited functionality

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks robust validation mechanisms during employee data imports, including inability to prevent duplicate employee IDs, handle soft-deleted records, manage type column modifications for existing employees, and provide accurate error reporting for incomplete data. Import processes can fail silently or produce misleading error messages that reference incorrect columns.

The platform experiences multiple frontend rendering problems including document card layout distortion across screen resolutions, health insurance policy dropdown invisibility after first employee creation, intermittent option selection errors where clicking one option selects another, and unexpected data change dialogs during navigation. These issues suggest underlying state management and component initialization problems.

The document management system lacks user confirmation mechanisms for OCR-driven document type changes, automatic document relationship maintenance when documents are replaced, delete functionality for unwanted uploads, and clear file size validation messaging. OCR can misclassify documents without user oversight, and document linking breaks when documents are edited or replaced.

The platform cannot handle complex hierarchical employee deletions, particularly when an employee and their reporting manager need simultaneous deletion. Concurrent deletion attempts trigger Hibernate stale state exceptions. Additionally, user deletion fails when soft-deletable related entities exist, and the system lacks cascade delete logic for interconnected records.

The platform allows work email changes for registered users, compromising data consistency and verification processes. Additionally, the admin panel has restrictions on directly modifying user email addresses, requiring multi-step email synchronization workflows before username updates. These constraints create confusion and inefficient user management processes.

The platform lacks comprehensive controls for managing hire date changes across different system modules. The mixed architecture (PHP and Kotlin) complicates implementing consistent restrictions and validation. Hire date modifications can create data inconsistencies across employee records, leave balances, time-off requests, and payroll reimbursement modules.

The platform has inconsistent and unclear error messaging across multiple form fields. The Emirates ID field lacks descriptive error messages, the Legal Country of Residence searchbox is non-functional, and validation feedback does not provide clear, actionable guidance to users. These gaps reduce data entry accuracy and user experience quality.

The platform lacks a streamlined, dedicated employee search endpoint with role-based filtering and minimal data return. Current search mechanisms are inefficient for dropdown selections and lack granular access control. The system cannot dynamically filter employee results based on user roles or provide lightweight search results for quick selection interfaces.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Document Editing Permissions & Dependent Document Controls
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks nuanced document editing controls for dependent documents across different document types. There is no mechanism to dynamically restrict document modifications based on insurance policy stage or administrative preferences. Editing restrictions are inconsistent across document types, preventing precise management of sensitive documents.

The platform allows mentioning inactive or off-boarded employees in comments and leave request interactions, creating confusion and inappropriate interaction scenarios. The system lacks robust mechanisms to automatically restrict mentions or interactions with employees who are no longer active in the organization. Additionally, inactive employees can be assigned in workflows where they should be excluded.

The platform has technical constraints preventing successful Excel file generation and download in the View Team Page. Date formatting in Turkish region settings produces incorrect Excel export outputs. The system cannot consistently render date formats across regional configurations, and export mechanisms lack comprehensive localization support.

The platform lacks a robust, centralized logging system for employee record updates from multiple sources (domains, Excel imports). There is no comprehensive mechanism to track changes to employee information. Additionally, the platform lacks automated workflows for department change requests and CSM contact information in welcome emails. The backend architecture has HR-related classes tightly coupled in the core module, complicating future migrations and scalability.
